Jeffrey C. King is an American philosopher and Distinguished Professor of Philosophy at Rutgers University.
He  is known for his works on philosophy of language.
Books
* Felicitous Underspecification: Contextually Sensitive Expressions Lacking Unique Semantic Values in Context, Oxford University Press, 2021, 176pp.,
* New Thinking about Propositions, co-authored with Scott Soames and Jeff Speaks, Oxford University Press, 2014,
* The Nature and Structure of Content, Oxford University Press, 2007, 230pp.,
* Complex Demonstratives: A Quantificational Account. MIT Press. 200, 221pp.,
